meanings.sent1: I am subclassifying my toys by putting all the cars in one box.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys subclassifying her books based on their genres.
meanings.sent3: The librarian was subclassifying the books so fast, she almost turned into a book herself!
meanings.sent4: His mind was like a busy library, subclassifying thoughts into different categories.
meanings.sent5: Subclassifying is like organizing a messy room into neat sections.

meanings.definition: The act of categorizing into a smaller group.
meanings.sent1: The subclassifying of animals into mammals and reptiles was interesting to learn about.
meanings.sent2: Her subclassifying of plants helped her understand their characteristics better.
meanings.sent3: The party planner's subclassifying of guests into different groups made for a fun mix of people.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, subclassifying different styles is crucial for designers.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's subclassifying of elements paved the way for new discoveries.
